title: Guiding Light 1991-2002 logo
content:
Hi, does anybody know what is the name of the font used in the old Guiding Light logo? A reply will be appreciated! Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Guiding%20Light%20Logo%201991-2002_6534.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GL%201991%202_3794.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GL%201991_5637.png)
author: Daniel Bent

comments.content: Nobody knows what it is? I'm guessing it's a custom-made logo.

Probably lettering.  
Closest fonts I found are:  
 Ambule BT [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/ambule-bt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/ambule-bt/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/ambule-bt/") which has a similar \_N\_ and \_G\_.  
FF DIN Cond Black [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/") which has a similar \_G\_. Flip the \_U\_ for \_N\_. Similar Engschrift [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/engschrift/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/engschrift/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/engschrift/")  
Don

All letters have generally similar shapes: Galerie 2 Bold

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Galerie2AsGUIDINGLIGHT_5753.gif)
  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/artytype/galerie-2/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/artytype/galerie-2/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/artytype/galerie-2/")  
Don

It reminds me also of Techno: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/techno/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/techno/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/techno/")
Okay! Thanks for your suggestions guys!

Good find Riccardo.  
Inserting letters from the regular [\_D\_ and \_L\_] into the round version makes a text which is a fair match for the letter-forms

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/EunoiaRegAsGUIDING_3788.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/EunoiaRoundAsGUIDING_5088.gif)
  
Don
I think I will go with Eunoia. Thanks guys!

I found another similar font. This one is very similar if you modify the "T": [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/lithia/bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/lithia/bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/lithia/bold/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/99b83cc656e21d847744274b906768_6645.gif)

Lithia has less contrast than Eunoia, which seems to be a better match to GUIDING LIGHT .  
Note that Lithia Bold Small Caps

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415233949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LithiaBoldSCAsguiding@90_3433.jpg)
 gives a wider result. Have to edit the \_T\_ and \_L\_, drop the center section on \_G\_ and flip \_U\_ to make \_N\_.  
Otherwise, is it a closer match to GUIDING LIGHT than the upper case?  
Don
